channel.title: Hardware Installations
channel.description:
I'm having a little problem with some hardware for a MP3 and was wondering is there some place where I can remove it and see if having it reinstalled will help fix the problem.
I'm using Windows XP, so does someone know?

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

I plug in codecs to my computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

rip4d:

Did it come with drivers to install?

No, it didn’t come with much. It came with a cord that plugs into the computer, and another end of the cord will plug into the MP3.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Did it come with drivers to install?

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:6, topic:398385”]Have you tried restarting your PC (I know dumb question, but still).

Is there any specific software to add it or is it just like a USB storage? Like Ipod->Itunes.[/quote]
Yeah, but seeing as I’ve tried it on numerous other devices/console, I would presume that’s not the problem.

It’s a USB mass storage device, like a flash drive, and I know it’s because of the MP3 because my Andriod has the same kind of function when I plug it into the labtop and the other devices/console and it works perfectly, can upload music or videos etc. So I would obviously assume it’s the MP3 itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Have you tried restarting your PC (I know dumb question, but still).

Is there any specific software to add it or is it just like a USB storage? Like Ipod->Itunes.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:4, topic:398385”]Does it show up in the “My Computer” section? What MP3 player is it?

I’d try another computer if you have one to see if it shows up, you could have something interfering with the device. (software)[/quote]
It doesn’t even show up in that bin either, I’ve even attempted to make the Xbox format the MP3 with configuring it to Xbox software, but it wouldn’t even show up on the Xbox as well as the desktop.

Well, I was searching for that as a matter of fact and I couldn’t even find it, however, the MP3 says ‘Etec Digital Audio Player’.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Does it show up in the “My Computer” section? What MP3 player is it?

I’d try another computer if you have one to see if it shows up, you could have something interfering with the device. (software)

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Installations
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Muroth:

What’s the problem? The PC or MP3 itself?

It seems to be the MP3, when I plug the MP3 with the USB cord given when purchasing the MP3. It doesn’t show the hardware safe removal tool, as well as the little box poping up like to either open up the music files in mediaplayer, or open up the files to add more music into it etc.

At some point it made the click noise stating that it needs to be installed, but after at least 30 seconds of it attempting to install the hardware for the MP3, a little pop up was saying that their seems to be a problem with the hardware for the device.

Read full topic
